priority.when: To run automated test suites (e.g., pytest, unittest)
priority.why: Automated tests quickly catch regressions and failures

priority.when: To review test code, logs, and documentation
priority.why: Understanding test coverage and failure details is critical for QA

priority.when: To update or add test cases, or document QA findings
priority.why: QA may need to improve test coverage or document issues

best_practices.practice: Use clear, standard commands for running tests (e.g., pytest, python -m unittest)
Capture and save output logs for reporting
Rerun failed tests to confirm issues
Read test files and logs to understand failures
Review QA documentation for process alignment

Document new test cases or QA findings clearly
